text: right|180px|thumb|Left: breve in modern notation. Centre: breve in mensural notation used in some modern scores as well. Right: less common stylistic variant of the first form. A double whole note (also called a breve) is a note that is double the value of a whole note, which is where it gets its name. In the \frac 4 4 time signature it has the value of 8 beats or two measures. ==References== * * * * * * * * Category:Note values
title: Double whole note
